definition: (literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need

sentences.english: The three part of the kneading, legislation can be achieved remission or eliminate fatigue.

sentences.english: Natural selection has favored certain defenses against cancer but cannot eliminate it altogether.

sentences.english: Tanigaki refused on the grounds that the LDP does not eliminate policy differences with the Democratic Party.

definition: to cause a wound to close up and heal
to melt like ice and break like tiles/to disintegrate/to dissolve
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
to water down/to play down/to trivialize/to weaken/to become dull with time/to desalinate/desalination
to settle (a dispute)/to quieten down/to suppress
